title: Selendang (shoulder Cloth), 1971-50-495, 1900–71
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: hand drawn wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Long, narrow shoulder cloth (selendang) or sash in dark indigo-blue and light blue-gray. Field is a continuous pattern dominated by the "sawat" or "mirong" motif (wings of Garuda, mount of Vishnu) and small individual blossoms. Border is a continuous floral vine with a squared blossom in each corner. Imitating fringe (10.5cm) and warp fringe (6-7cm) at both ends.
